https://tmrev.io/movie/703949-At Those Terrifying Frontiers Where the Existence and Disappearance of People Fade into Each Other 2022-11-27
xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-image/1.1" xmlns:video="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-video/1.1">
https://tmrev.io/movie/703949-At Those Terrifying Frontiers Where the Existence and Disappearance of People Fade into Each Other 2022-11-27
https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/1dK7GGOQ1la419vJCJxhxB5RtPf.jpg Hybrid in form, this work from Basel Abbas and Ruanne Abou-Rahme wrestles with the problematics of representing a people displaced and disappeared. An avatar generating software and images of the people who participated in the Great March of Return demonstrations create figures that sing a sad lament. Voiced by the artists themselves yet digitally altered, they are, at once, human and non-human. At Those Terrifying Frontiers Where the Existence and Disappearance of People Fade into Each Other
